dcterms:creator: D. Gray
S. Brennan
H. Tao
dcterms:description: The VIPeR dataset is the most commonly used dataset for person re-identification, containing 632 pedestrian pairs, each with two images of the same person captured from different camera views, with significant viewpoint changes.
dcterms:title: VIPeR

dcterms:creator: W. Li
R. Zhao
X. Wang
dcterms:description: The CUHK01 dataset consists of 971 persons, each with two images captured from two different camera views, providing a challenging environment for person re-identification due to variations in viewpoint and occlusions.
dcterms:title: CUHK01
